definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
variant of 心怦怦跳[xin1 peng1 peng1 tiao4]
variant of 心怦怦跳[xin1 peng1 peng1 tiao4]

sentences.english: The encyclopedia thudded onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 那本百科全书砰地掉在地板上。

sentences.english: It tumbled down through the bleeding tree and landed at our feet with a thud.
sentences.chinese: 它从满是树脂的树上跌下来，砰的一声落在我们脚前。
我听到门砰地响了一声。

sentences.english: The cork popped out and the Champagne gushed from the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 木塞砰的一声打开，香槟酒从瓶中溢了出来。

sentences.english: The butler turned and hurried into the house, slamming the door behind him.
sentences.chinese: 看门人拔脚朝屋里跑去，门在他身后砰的一声关上了。

sentences.english: He slammed the door in a spirit of defiance.
sentences.chinese: 他以挑衅性的态度把门砰地一下关上。

sentences.english: The thick book whomped to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 那本厚书砰的一声掉在地上。

sentences.english: Once you believe, then it’s on and popping like popcorn.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你相信，它就会像爆米花一样“砰”地弹出来。

sentences.english: Hethumped his head on the floor when he fell out of bed.
sentences.chinese: 他掉下床时头砰的一声撞在地板上。

sentences.english: She threw in the latest addition and slammed the door.
sentences.chinese: 她赶紧把新用完的购物袋扔进去，砰地一声关上橱门。

sentences.english: He flumped his cup on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他砰地把杯子放在桌上。

sentences.english: He banged the chair against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他把椅子往墙上砰地一摔。

sentences.english: The champagne cork popped when he pulled it out.
sentences.chinese: 他拔香槟酒的瓶塞时它砰的一声开了。

sentences.english: The hot toast popped up in the toaster.
sentences.chinese: 热土司砰的一声从烤面包机中跳起。

sentences.english: The hammer thumped against the wood.
The impact accordioned the car beneath the truck.
sentences.chinese: 砰地一撞，小轿车在卡车底下被压扁了。
